answers.answer: It could be a few things ...1. You could be lacking calcium, drinking more milk can help to relieve the pain2. You could be lacking vitamin C, eating foods that contain vitamin can help with the pain or drinking more orange juice.3. Leg cramps like growing pains you had in your leg as a child can be treated by taking a teaspoon of yellow mustard when you feel the pain can help relieve the pain. It must be yellow mustard such as french's.4. You could have something going on with circulation that must be addressed by a doctor5. If your leg is swollen, red, or your leg in an area feels warmer as if you can feel heat from some type of infection to the area seek medical help immediately as you could have a blood clot.
its not warmer, but it is very hard all the time

With your pain in the leg, does this pain radiate all the way down your leg?If so, then what you have is a back problem when the sciatic nerve is being pinched or aggravated.Did you do any physical exercise or lifting anything heavy before the onset of the problem?Make an appointment with your doctor to find out the cause.  Ignoring it thinking it will just go away may do you more harm than good.If the pain is severe you may need to have some medication to relax the muscles that are going into spasm.  Take pain relief medication as directed on the packet.  If it is sciatica and back problems the doctor may refer you for physiotherapy.

It sounds like leg cramps, especially since the muscle is hard afterward.  My dad gets leg cramps all the time, every day but especially at night. I've had them before, too, and my leg is always like a rock the next morning and it's hard to walk, but I haven't gotten them since high school.Potassium helps to prevent muscle cramps. Bananas and especially avocados are high in potassium, and so are potatoes but its in the skin and a lot of people don't eat the skin of potatoes.Get checked, I would say, especially since this has been happening for about four months now and is keeping you up at night.

question: Hey, Im 20 years old I have this random excrucating pain in my right leg at night. It keeps me up all night somtimes the pain is so bad I wake up screaming or crying. This has been going on since June. My father has diabetes but I do not though I am over weight. What could it be?
title: leg pain
